courses.name: AB in Communication
courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Communication program explores communication theory, media studies, and digital media. Graduates can work as communication specialists, journalists, or public relations experts.

courses.name: AB in Economics
courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Economics program covers microeconomics, macroeconomics, and economic policy. Graduates can pursue careers in economics, finance, or government policy analysis.

courses.name: AB in History
courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in History program emphasizes historical research, world history, and historiography. Graduates can become historians, researchers, or work in archival management.

courses.name: AB in Journalism
courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Journalism program covers journalistic writing, media ethics, and various forms of journalism. Graduates can work as journalists, editors, or media professionals.

courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Literature program focuses on literary analysis, world literature, and literary theory. Graduates can work as literary analysts, educators, or pursue advanced studies in literature.

courses.name: AB in Mass Communication
courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Mass Communication program explores mass media, media production, and media effects. Graduates can work in media production, advertising, or media law.

courses.name: AB in Philosophy
courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Philosophy program delves into philosophical ethics, epistemology, metaphysics, and logic. Graduates can pursue careers in philosophy, academia, or critical thinking roles.

courses.name: AB in Political Science
courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Political Science program covers political theory, comparative politics, and international relations. Graduates can work in government, diplomacy, or policy analysis.

courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Sociology program explores sociological theory, social research, and cultural sociology. Graduates can work as sociologists, researchers, or in social policy analysis.

courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Social Science program encourages interdisciplinary studies in social sciences, humanities, and cultural studies. Graduates can work in education, research, or cultural analysis.

courses.description: The Bachelor of Arts in Theology program focuses on theological studies, religious ethics, and biblical studies. Graduates can become theologians, religious educators, or pursue advanced studies in theology.

courses.description: The Bachelor of Agricultural Technology program covers agricultural technology, crop production, and livestock management. Graduates can work in agricultural technology, farm management, or agricultural extension.
